data.description: The data for which null values will be imputed.

min.description: A lower bound on data elements for each column. Used only if `categories` is `None`.

max.description: An upper bound on data elements for each column. Used only if `categories` is `None`.

categories.description: The set of categories you want to be represented for each column of the data, if the data is categorical.

weights.description: Optional. The weight of each category when imputing. Uniform weights are used if not specified.

distribution.description: The distribution to be used when imputing records. Used only if `categories` is `None`.

shift.description: The expectation of the Gaussian distribution to be used for imputation. Used only if `distribution` is `Gaussian`.

scale.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution to be used for imputation. Used only if `distribution` is `Gaussian`.

name: impute

return.description: Data with null values replaced by imputed values.

description:
Replaces null values with draws from a specified distribution.

If the `categories` argument is provided, the data are considered to be categorical regardless of atomic type and the elements provided in `null_value` will be replaced with those in `categories` according to `weights`.

If the `categories` argument is not provided, the data are considered to be numeric and elements that are `f64::NAN` will be replaced according to the specified distribution.
